title: How to Paint Marbled Paper Using Shaving Cream

steps.headline: Apply a small amount of shaving cream to the pan (or use wax paper) so that you can make a layer that is a little wider than your cardstock sheet and about 1/4 " (1.25 cm) thick.
Use the back of a squeegee (or you can use a ruler) to spread the shaving cream out to a nice even layer.
Drop 1 drop of each food colors or paint, evenly spread out, on the shaving cream layer.
steps.description: (You can also use a spray bottle to apply the dye.)

steps.headline: Use a stick or toothpick to swirl through the shaving cream and color drops to spread the color out in streaks across the shaving cream.
Lay the cardstock on the shaving cream and gently press to make sure the cardstock contacts the colored areas.
Peel the cardstock off the shaving cream and lay on a clean area of the pan.
Scrape the squeegee (or edge of the ruler) across the cardstock to remove the shaving cream, leaving the color behind.
Set the painted cardstock aside to dry.
steps.description: If the paper starts to curve or curl, you may wish to put a book or pan  on top to flatten it out before it dries.

Use the back of a squeegee (or you can use a ruler) to spread the shaving cream out to a nice even layer.  Drop 1 drop of each food colors or paint, evenly spread out, on the shaving cream layer. (You can also use a spray bottle to apply the dye.) Use a stick or toothpick to swirl through the shaving cream and color drops to spread the color out in streaks across the shaving cream.  Lay the cardstock on the shaving cream and gently press to make sure the cardstock contacts the colored areas.  Peel the cardstock off the shaving cream and lay on a clean area of the pan.  Scrape the squeegee (or edge of the ruler) across the cardstock to remove the shaving cream, leaving the color behind.  Set the painted cardstock aside to dry. If the paper starts to curve or curl, you may wish to put a book or pan  on top to flatten it out before it dries. Finished.
